qas.question: What year did John Rut visit St. John's?
Who sent the first known letter from North America?
What three countries ships did John Rut find in 1527?
Who did John Rut write a letter to in 1527?
What did Pedro Reinel call St John's in the 15th century?
What did Pedro Reinal find in the harbor in 1527?
What king did Reinel write to in 1527?
What is the oldest street in the America's?
How was St. John's refereed to on Nicholas Desliens Atlas?

context: The earliest record of the location appears as <b4_0>São João<b4_0/> on a Portuguese map by Pedro Reinel in 1519. When <a1_0>John Rut<a1_0/> visited St. John's in <a0_0>1527<a0_0/> he found <a2_0><b5_0>Norman, Breton and Portuguese<a2_0/> ships<b5_0/> in the harbour. On 3 August 1527, Rut wrote a letter to <a3_0><b6_0>King Henry<b6_0/><a3_0/> on the findings of his voyage to North America; this was the first known letter sent from North America. St. Jehan is shown on Nicholas Desliens' world map of 1541 and <b8_0>San Joham<b8_0/> is found in João Freire's Atlas of 1546. It was during this time that <b7_0>Water Street<b7_0/> was first developed, making it the oldest street in North America.[dubious – discuss]
